title: Hillary's fake accomplishments
text: One of the things I see mentioned frequently as one of Hillary Clinton's "accomplishments" is the eight years that she spent in the White House from 1993 to 2001. There are references to how she "served" as first lady, as if this were an elected position. It's not. If the eight years that she lived in the White House is an accomplishment and qualifies her for the presidency, then what about all the other people that have spent years at the White House? Gary Walters has been the White House's chief usher for almost 30 years. Christine Limerick has been the executive housekeeper at the White House for 12 years. I am certain that both of them are excellent at their jobs and work very long, hard hours. But does the fact that they work in the White House automatically count as a qualification for president? If Deanna Favre (Brett's ex-wife) asserted that she was qualified to be the starting QB for the Green Bay... (Read Full Post)
